'''David Graham''' (born 30 December 1930) is a [[United Kingdom|British]] [[character actor]] and voice artist. Born in [[London]], after a period in the [[Royal Air Force|R.A.F]] as a Radar Mechanic he trained as an actor in [[New York]] but has worked mainly on British television series.
Graham played several characters on ''[[Doctor Who]]'', most notably the [[Dalek]]s in the 1960s stories ''[[The Daleks]]'', ''[[The Dalek Invasion of Earth]]'', ''[[The Chase (Doctor Who)|The Chase]]'' (where he also provided Mechanoid voices) and ''[[The Daleks Master Plan]]''. He also played the barman Charlie in ''[[The Gunfighters]]'' and foreign time-travel scientist Professor Kerensky in the 1979 story ''[[City of Death]]''.
He was also the voices of [[Aloysius "Nosey" Parker|Parker]], Brains, Gordon Tracy, and Kyrano in the original television series of ''[[Thunderbirds (TV series)|Thunderbirds]]'' and its [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off]] films ''[[Thunderbirds Are GO]]'' and ''[[Thunderbird 6]]''. He had roles in several other [[Gerry Anderson]] productions, including ''[[Stingray (TV series)|Stingray]]'', ''[[Fireball XL5]]'', ''[[Four Feather Falls]]'', ''[[The Secret Service (TV show)|The Secret Service]]'' and ''[[Supercar (TV series)|Supercar]]''.
Graham appeared in ''[[Callan (TV series)|Callan]]'', ''[[Timeslip]]'', ''[[So Haunt Me]]'', ''[[Danger Man]]'', ''[[The Saint (TV series)|The Saint]]'', ''[[Howards' Way]]'', ''[[Softly, Softly (TV series)|Softly, Softly]]'', ''[[Armchair Thriller]]'', ''[[Ace of Wands]]'', ''[[Justice (TV series)|Justice]]'', ''[[The Regiment]]'', ''[[The Bill]]'', ''[[The Fixer (TV series)|The Fixer]]'', ''[[The Sentimental Agent]]'', ''[[Timeslip]]'' and ''[[The Avengers (TV series)|The Avengers]]'' (in the 1963 episode "Man in the Mirror"). In the "[[1984 (television commercial)|1984]]" commercial introducing the [[Apple Macintosh]], he played the role of [[Big Brother (1984)|Big Brother]].<ref>[http://answers.google.com/answers/threadview?id=741952#a Google Answers article #741952]</ref>
He has also done puppet voices in two episodes of ''[[The Tomorrow People (TV series)|The Tomorrow People]]''.
He has also done voice roles in anime including the children's TV series ''[[Moomin (1990 TV series)|Moomin]]'' and the film ''[[Dominion: Tank Police]]''.
Graham is currently the voice of "Grandpa Pig" in the children's television program ''[[Peppa Pig]]'' and the voice of ''Wise Old Elf'' in [[Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom]].
